intro: Symphytonema lineare, commonly known as the linear symphyton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or along stream banks. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is relatively rare and is found primarily in specific regions of Southeast Asia.
